Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog

Class CourseCatalog

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.catalog.CourseCatalog
public class CourseCatalog
extends java.lang.Object
This class reads and stores all of the available Course records as a SortedList from a given file. The courses are stored in sorted order in catalog. Course records can then be written and saved onto a valid file.
Author:
Jongwoo Shin

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CourseCatalog()
    Constructs an empty SortedList of Course objects called catalog.

  • Constructor Details

    • CourseCatalog

      public CourseCatalog()
      Constructs an empty SortedList of Course objects called catalog.

  • Method Details

    • newCourseCatalog

      public void newCourseCatalog()
      Constructs an empty SortedList of Course objects called catalog.

    • loadCoursesFromFile

      public void loadCoursesFromFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads and stores Course objects read from a valid file into catalog. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the file cannot be found. Implements readCourseRecords from CourseRecordIO to read Courses from fileName.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the file to read Course records from
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if file cannot be found

    • addCourseToCatalog

      public boolean addCourseToCatalog​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String section, int credits, java.lang.String instructorId, int enrollmentCap, java.lang.String meetingDays, int startTime, int endTime)
      Returns true if Course is added to catalog and false if Course already exists in the catalog. Implements getCourseFromCatalog to check if course exists in the catalog. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if there is an error in constructing the Course object.
      Parameters:
      name - Course's name
      title - Course's title
      section - Course's section
      credits - number of credits for Course
      instructorId - instructor's id
      meetingDays - Course's meeting days
      startTime - start time for Course
      endTime - end time for Course
      enrollmentCap - cap of student in a course
      Returns:
      true if Course was successfully added, false if Course already exists in catalog
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Course cannot be constructed

    • removeCourseFromCatalog

      public boolean removeCourseFromCatalog​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String section)
      Returns true if Course was successfully removed from the catalog and returns false if the course does not exist in the catalog.
      Parameters:
      name - Course's name
      section - Course's section
      Returns:
      true if course was removed from catalog, false if course does not exist in catalog

    • getCourseFromCatalog

      public Course getCourseFromCatalog​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String section)
      Returns Course object if course exists in the catalog. This method scans the catalog using course name and section as parameters. If course does not exist in the catalog, null is returned.
      Parameters:
      name - Course's name
      section - Course's section
      Returns:
      Course object that corresponds with name and section parameters if the course exists in the catalog. If course is nonexistent, null is returned

    • getCourseCatalog

      public java.lang.String[][] getCourseCatalog()
      Scans the catalog and returns a 2D String array with the course's name, section, title, and the meeting string. Implements the getShortDisplayArray method from Course class.
      Returns:
      2D String array with a row for each course and four columns for name, section, title, and meeting string. Returns empty 2D String array if catalog is empty

    • saveCourseCatalog

      public void saveCourseCatalog​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Writes Course records in the catalog onto a valid file. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the file cannot be saved. Implements writeCourseRecords from CoureRecordIO to export the catalog onto fileName.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of file to save Course records to
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be saved
